business.headline: Sensex, Nifty closing: Top stocks that gained and lost on BSE, NSEIT and auto sector stocks dragged the market down. The fall in IT and auto stocks is linked to concerns over US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to come into effect on April 2.

Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: How much salary will central government employees get?With the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

How India saw a billionaire boom in just 10 yearsIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start on March 6 as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.
Wall Street drifts as auto tariffs hurt GM, help Tesla and othersDonald Trump's auto tariffs impacted Wall Street on Thursday morning, with autogiant General Motors falling by 6.8%.

Trump's 25% auto tariff: Which Indian companies will pay the priceUS President Donald Trump's 25% tariff on car imports will affect a few Indian companies, including Tata Motors, Eicher Motors, and Samvardhana Motherson. These firms ship components to the US and Europe's markets.

Sensex, Nifty close higher: Top gainers and losers, tariff impact and key driversStock market today: Some of the top gainers during today's session were Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd Bank, NTPC, L&T, Ultratech Cement, Hero MotoCorp, Adani Enterprises and BPCL. On the other hand, some of the top losers were Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCLTech.

Sensex ends 318 points higher, Nifty just below 23,600; Tata Motors down 5%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 317.93 points higher at 77,606.43, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 105.10 points to settle at 23,591.95.

Noida, Greater Noida flat registration fees may rise 20-30%According to a draft notification, circle rates in Noida could see a 20% hike, while in Greater Noida, the increase may go up to 30%. The move is expected to make property transactions more expensive in the region.

India may receive reprieve from proposed US tariffs: SourcesIndia may escape the proposed US tariffs and avoid being grouped with nations like China, Mexico, and Canada, according to government sources. Trade talks between the two countries are progressing smoothly, with no signs of a deadlock as the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs approaches.

RBI may double foreign individual investor limit to 10% in listed firms: ReportForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), pressured by poor earnings, high valuations and prospects of U.S. tariffs, have pulled more than $28 billion out of Indian stocks since September's record high in the benchmark NSE Nifty 50.

Elon Musk leads Hurun Global Rich List despite $100 billion drop in net worthElon Musk has reretained his position as the wealthiest person in the world for the fourth time in five years, becoming the first individual to surpass the $400 billion threshold, noted the Hurun Research report.

US tariff reprieve for India, may not be treated like China, Canada, Mexico: SourcesTrade talks between the two nations are progressing smoothly, with no deadlock expected before the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs.

Infosys terminates more trainees from Mysuru campus, but offers…: ReportInfosys has terminated more trainees from its Myrusu campus. The IT giant had terminated hundreds of trainees from the same campus just two months ago.

Tata Motors shares slump as US slaps 25% duty on car importsTata Motors stock price: Tata Motors shares slumped 6% in early trade and were trading 5.26% lower at Rs 670.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9.55 am.

Sensex, Nifty gain after opening lower in volatile trade; Wipro rises nearly 2%Stock market opening: While the Sensex opened 100 points lower, it was trading 64.27 points higher at 77,552.77 at around 9.26 am. The Nifty50 was trading 16.75 points higher at 23,503.60.

Top stocks to watch today: Tata Motors, Wipro, JB Chemicals, Infosys, Vedanta, UPLWhile positive cues are likely to support the two leading indices on Dalal Street, US tariff uncertainty looms large. Here are some of the key stocks that will be in focus today.

Stock market on March 27: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty today?Stock market prediction: Nifty and Sensex have gained nearly 2% in the past five sessions, but investors will now be watching to see if the market can recover from Wednesday's drop.

How can India cement its position in the global value chain?With global value chains (GVCs) driving over 70% of international trade, India's growth story hinges on its ability to integrate into and scale within these networks.

Tesla to enter Saudi Arabia as Elon Musk mends rift with kingdomAmerican EV giant Tesla announced its entry into the Saudi Arabian market after company CEO Elon Musk's relations with the Kingdom improved in recent months.

UPI outage hits several users across India, NPCI says issue resolvedThe National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) acknowledged the issue, stating that it was caused by intermittent technical difficulties, resulting in partial transaction failures.
Wall Street is drifting again after getting whipsawed for weeksThe New York Stock Exchange saw a steady opening on Wednesday with marginal drops for S&P 500 and the Nasdaq composite.

Cancer, diabetes drugs under government price control to get costlier: SourcesGovernment-controlled medicines, including that of cancer, diabetes, heart-related concerns and other antibiotics, are set to become more expensive by 1.7 per cent, government sources told India Today TV's sister publication, Business Today.

Stock market closing: Top gainers and losers on Sensex, NiftyBenchmark indices snapped their seven-day winning streak, as investors turned cautious ahead of the monthly expiry. The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 728.69 points to close at 77,288.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 181.80 points, ending the session at 23,486.85.

India may lower duties on Harley-Davidson bikes, bourbon whiskey: SourcesIndia may further reduce import duties on Harley-Davidson motorcycles, US wines, and bourbon whiskey as part of ongoing India-US trade talks, according to sources.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points, Nifty settles below 23,500; IndusInd Bank up 3%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 728.69 points lower to 77,288.50,  while the NSE Nifty50 declined 181.80 points to settle at 23,486.85.

entertainment.headline: Empuraan 1st day box office records: 5 historic benchmarks set by Mohanlal's filmMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'L2: Empuraan' is already rocking the box office. The film is yet to cover the first weekend, and it has set the cash registers ringing. Here's how.

Through powerful storytelling, these dramas address school violence, online harassment, and the emotional scars left behind.

Athiya Shetty shares glimpse of homecoming after embracing motherhoodAthiya Shetty and KL Rahul became parents of their first child, a daughter, on March 24. Athiya has shared a glimpse of their welcome ceremony on social media.
Where Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly stand after welcoming their baby girlMegan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly welcome their baby girl on March 27, 2025, months after ending their engagement.

Sikandar new song Hum Aapke Bina brings out Salman-Rashmika's chemistry. WatchThe team of 'Sikandar' released a romantic track from the film on Friday. Titled 'Hum Aapke Bina', it is sung by Arijit Singh, and highlights Salman Khan-Rashmika Mandanna's chemistry.

Adolescence creator Jack Thorne disagrees with 'race-swapping' criticism of show'Adolescence' has triggered an argument about 'race-swapping', with several users claiming that the character of Jamie Miller was based on black teens allegedly committing knife crime in the UK.

Avengers Doomsday brings back X-Men favourites James Marsden, Ian McKellenAvengers: Doomsday brings back X-Men legends James Marsden, Ian McKellen, and more! Marvel fans can expect a nostalgic reunion as the MCU expands its multiverse.

Aditi Rao's AI-generated 'Bibbo Ghibli Jaan' is the cutest thing on the InternetActor Aditi Rao Hydari joined the growing list of celebrities experimenting with ChatGPT's new AI feature, which transforms images into Ghibli-style versions. She used it to give her Heeramandi character, Bibbojaan, a whimsical makeover, much to the delight of her fans.

Mohanlal plants a kiss on Prithviraj's mother at L2 Empuraan screening. WatchMohanlal recently attended the L2 Empuraan screening in Kerala. A viral video showed the veteran actor planting a kiss on Prithviraj Sukumaran's mother at the event.

Ananya Panday's reaction to 'Mr World Wide' Walker Blanco's post has fans talkingActor Ananya Panday has once again got the internet talking with her comment on rumoured boyfriend Walker Blanco's post. The two have reportedly been dating after Anant Ambani's Jamnagar bash.

Actor Shruti Haasan's Hyderabad live concert postponed. Here's whyActor Shruti Haasan was supposed to perform a live concert in Hyderabad on March 28. However, the event was postponed hours before the scheduled time.

Decoding Akshaye Khanna's secret to staying relevant in BollywoodDespite his absence from the public eye, actor Akshaye Khanna has managed to stay relevant through his iconic film choices and powerful performances. On his 50th birthday today, we take a look at his illustrious filmography and how he has redefined versatility and excellence in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan says 'Hindu-Muslim wasn't the issue' in parents' marriageSalman Khan revealed that the biggest hurdle in his parents' marriage wasn't religion but Salim Khan's career in Bollywood. Salim and Salma Khan got married in 1964.

Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan reacts after alleged casting couch video leakTamil actor Shruthi Narayanan addressed the controversy after her alleged casting couch video surfaced online, urging people not to circulate it further. She described the situation as challenging for her family and herself, appealing for sensitivity and respect

Kartik Aaryan can't take his eyes off 'zindagi' Sreeleela in new picKartik Aaryan and Sreeleela shared a new romantic photo on social media. The image featured the two sitting in what seemed like a tea garden. The photo spoke volumes of their chemistry.

Actor Vikram takes auto to avoid crowd after meeting Sivakarthikeyan at screeningActor Vikram, fondly called Chiyaan by fans, attended the screening of his film, Veera Dheera Sooran's Part 2, in Chennai. After the screening, the actor left for his home in an auto to avoid the crowd at the theatre.

Shivaji Satam on CID's success: We seem like real heroes, we don't fly or jumpShivaji Satam talked about CID's animated version, the show's enduring legacy, and its return to TV. He reflected on its cult status, meme culture, and why it never glorified violence or crime.

Honey Bunny actor reacts after being mistaken for Tamil star Shruthi Narayanan'Citadel: Honey Bunny' actor Shruti Narayann has faced personal and professional challenges due to being mistaken for Tamil actor Shruthi Narayanan. The mix-up has led to harassment and work-related setbacks for Narayann.

Neha Kakkar's husband defends her after Melbourne concert backlashSinger Neha Kakkar defended herself after facing backlash in Melbourne, revealing organisers fled with funds. Husband Rohanpreet Singh supported her, urging people not to judge without knowing both sides.

general news.headline: Huge earthquake topples buildings in Myanmar, Thailand; several killed Live UpdatesMyanmar Earthquake News: Such was the impact of the earthquake that a high-rise collapsed in Bangkok, around 900 km away, killing two labourers and trapping over 40 others.

Justice Varma's transfer cleared, High Court asked not to assign him judicial workFollowing the recovery of the cash pile from his residence during a fire incident last week, Justice Varma was repatriated from the Delhi High Court to the Allahabad High Court.

Mohanlal's Empuraan earns Congress praise, party says it exposed Sangh agendaMohanlal-starrer Empuraan sparked discussions on social media after indirectly portraying incidents in connection with the Gujarat riots.

Vehicles torched as pro-monarchists clash with cops in Nepal, curfew in 3 areasPro-monarchy activists in Nepal clashed with police in Kathmandu on Friday as they demanded the restoration of the monarchy and Hindu Kingdom status.

The lost grave of Dara Shikoh, murdered by brother AurangzebMughal emperor Aurangzeb got his brother Dara Shikoh beheaded in Delhi and presented his head to their father, Shah Jahan, whom he had imprisoned in Agra. Experts believe India's history would have been different had a scholarly and secular Dara become the emperor. Amid the controversy over Aurangzeb's grave, a look at the life of Dara, who translated the Upanishads into Persian, and the mystery around his tomb.

CSK vs RCB Live: Unbreachable Chepauk awaits Kohli-PatidarChennai Super Kings (CSK) vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) Live Updates: Rajat Patidar's RCB are set to take on Ruturaj Gaikwad's CSK in their second match of the season. Can RCB's reamed batting order take on Chennai's spin trap?

Joke row: Kunal Kamra gets interim pre-arrest bail, claims he got 500 threat callsKunal Kamra's counsel claimed that the comedian received 500 threatening calls after his 'traitor' jab at Eknath Shinde during a stand-up performance.

Videos: Building collapses in Bangkok, bridge falls in Myanmar after major quakesTwo powerful earthquakes, measuring 7.7 and 6.4 in magnitude, hit Myanmar on Friday. The tremors were so strong that they were felt in Thailand's capital, Bangkok.

Pikachu electrifies Turkey protests, makes the world take noteProtesters in Turkey have taken to the streets against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after the arrest of his rival and Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu. The emergence of Pokemon character Pikachu at a protest site has made videos of the stir go viral. People across the globe are talking about the protest in Turkey now.

Video: Massive fire at Greater Noida girls' hostel, students jump from balconyAn AC compressor blast sparked a huge fire at a girls' hostel in Greater Noida where two girls jumped from the second floor to save themselves.

Video: Infinity pool turns waterfall as tremors jolt Bangkok after Myanmar quakeA video of the earthquake captured the impact, showing water spilling from rooftop pools of a high-rise building in Bangkok due to the intense shaking.

TVK leader says Vijay is like atom bomb, claims Annamalai is DMK's settingAt the TVK general body meeting, Aadhav Arjuna accused the DMK of aiding BJP's growth and sidelining alliance partners. He warned AIADMK against a BJP alliance, criticised Annamalai's Tasmac protest, and questioned the DMK's political moves.
Are banks secretly charging you? List of hidden fees account holders must knowThink your bank services are free? Think again, hidden fees could be draining your money.

Israel's first big strikes on Beirut suburbs since truce with HezbollahIsrael on Friday launched a major attack on the Lebanese capital, Beirut, for the first time since a ceasefire ended the latest Israel-Hezbollah war in November.

Myanmar earthquake: Why this region is vulnerable to deadly seismic eventsThe seismic event highlights Myanmar's vulnerability to earthquakes, largely due to its location along the Sagaing Fault, a major tectonic boundary between the Indian Plate and the Burma microplate.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.

Hrithik Roshan to turn director with Krrish 4, father Rakesh Roshan announces'Krrish 4', which is India's biggest superhero franchise, is now being directed by the 'superhero' himself, Hrithik Roshan. The film will be produced by YRF.

'Yashu Yashu' pastor found guilty in 2018 sexual harassment case, jailedThe self-styled godman was arrested in connection to the same case in July 2018 at the Delhi airport while attempting to board a flight to London.

Uttarakhand's health advisory for Char Dham yatris: Dos and Don'tsPlanning to go on Char Dham Yatra? Prepare with walking, yoga, and a health check-up, according to the health advisory issued by the Uttarakhand government. Read on to know more about the challenges and how to prepare for the sacred journey.

Free speech can't be judged per standards of weak minds: Top court's big remarksThe Supreme Court's remarks came as it quashed an FIR filed against Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi over a poem uploaded by him on social media. It holds importance in the backdrop of the Kunal Kamra row.

Amid AI job threats, Bill Gates lists 3 professions that are safeMicrosoft founder Bill Gates has recently stated that while the AI job threat is real, there are a few careers that will not be affected. In an interview, he highlighted that energy professionals, biologists, and coders will be irreplaceable.

Service charge not mandatory, restaurants can't levy it: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court ruled that service charges on food bills are voluntary and dismissed petitions challenging the CCPA's guidelines prohibiting mandatory imposition by hotels and restaurants.

Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Vijay says 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly Election to be direct fight between DMK, TVKAt the TVK general body meeting, Vijay declared the 2026 Tamil Nadu elections as a direct fight between the TVK and DMK, attacking both Chief Minister MK Stalin and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Vijay accused DMK of corruption and the BJP of neglecting Tamil Nadu.

Joe Root not interested in becoming England ODI captain: The ship has sailedStar England batter Joe Root said that he isn't interested in captaining the England ODI team after Jos Buttler stepped down from his position. Root has never led England in ODIs.

After their triumph against KKR, will RCB be able to best the spin-trap in Chennai?

Dinesh Karthik backs Virat Kohli against spin, shares special Chepauk anecdoteIPL 2025: Speaking to the press on the eve of RCB's away game in Chennai, batting coach Dinesh Karthik downplayed concerns over Virat Kohli's ability to dominate spin. Kohli will face the spin trio of Noor Ahmed, R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja at Chepauk on Friday.

Rishabh Pant quotes MS Dhoni lesson after LSG prove doubters wrong in HyderabadIPL, SRH vs LSG: Rishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants proved doubters wrong after a cilincal win against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday, March 27. After the win, Pant quoted a crucial lesson from his mentor MS Dhoni in the post match presentation ceremony.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
